data.title: Joshua J. Cotton - Department of History and Philosophy
data.text:
Department of History and Philosophy

College of Liberal Arts

The Department of History and Philosophy welcomes you to its home page. Here we introduce our talented and student-friendly faculty, our undergraduate and graduate degree programs, and our organizations, clubs, events, activities, and projects.

Title: Instructor

Phone: 601-979-2368

Location: LIB #345

Email: Joshua.J.Cotton@Jsums.edu

DEGREES:

M.A., Jackson State University, History, 2009

B.A., Jackson State University, History, 2007

RESEARCH INTERESTS:

Military History

Japanese Feudal History

COURSES TAUGHT:

Current: History of Civilization 101, History of Civilization 102,

Formerly: University Success (Jackson State University), African American History (Talladega College), Black American History (Talladega College)

TA Work: Intro to Philosophy, Ethics, Logic, Aesthetics

PROFESSIONAL MEMBERSHIPS:

Phi Alpha Theta

Golden Key Honor Society

HCASC (Honda Campus-All Star Challenge)

RECENT PUBLICATIONS AND/OR CREATIVE WORKS:

Excerpt from: WHEN COMPARED WITH THE LOWEST HEAVEN: Nagashino,

The Sword of Heaven: The Role of European Firearms on the Development of Pre-Modern Japan,

The Artist and Death,

Once Upon a December
